H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7617.def: = a person or group that has been forcibly carried off into slavery or exile

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H113.def: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

H758.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as the founder of a land and ethnic group with the same name

H1416.def: = a group of armed humans equipped for fighting on land, whose main purpose is to execute swift attacks and loot and plunder as much as they can; sometimes also used to denote a unit of a more regular army

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H758.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as the founder of a land and ethnic group with the same name

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H4264.def: = open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H6696.def: = causative action by which humans attach one or more objects to another object that contains an opening ► in order to block entry and/or exit

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2543.def: = domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see {L:עַיִר<SDBH:עַיִר>}; female see {L:אָתֹון<SDBH:אָתֹון>}

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H8084.def: = state in which a countable entity is eight in number

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H7255.def: = state in which an entity is one out of four equal parts

H6894.def: = unit of dry measure of approximately 2 liters; 6 kabs make up one {L:seah<SDBH:סְאָה>}; 18 kabs make up 1 {L:ephah<SDBH:אֵיפָה>} (ABD);

H2716.def: = excrement; ◄ produced by animals and human beings; ► used as food in times of extreme hardship; may be used as fuel as well; ≈ this word appears to have been considered indecent because it has been replaced by a euphemism in all passages where it is found

H2568.def: = state in which a countable entity is five in number

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces
